titles.title: Beginning Farmer Technical Corrections Act of 1994
Beginning Farmer Technical Corrections Act of 1994
To amend the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to make technical corrections to certain provisions relating to beginning farmers and ranchers.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment, Credit and Rural Development.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Johnson (SD) asked unanimous consent to discharge from committee and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture.

bill.summary: 9/29/1994--Passed House amended. Beginning Farmer Technical Corrections Act of 1994 - Amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act with regard to agricultural credit to: (1) make specified land ownership limitations inapplicable to beginning farmer operating loans; (2) disregard rural youth loans in applying the ten-year commercial loan transition rule; and (3) consider separately direct loan and guarantee histories in applying such rule.
